titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States limiting the number of consecutive terms for Members of the House of Representatives and the Senate.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

bill.summary: 1/7/1997--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Limits Members of the House of Representatives to six consecutive terms and Members of the Senate to two consecutive terms.
